page.title: 17HORSE RIDING
page.content: The Mendips are a lovely place to go horse riding. Although there are no riding schools in this particular area, the country lanes do make a pleasant hack. Gymkhanas are held at many local venues including, Binegar, Emborough, Charterhouse and West Pennard. If you wish to join a pony club, the main one is Mendip Farmers based at Priddy. The local hunt is also the Mendip Farmers which is likewise based at Priddy. Point to Point races take place frequently in the spring at the racecourse just to the east of Nedge Hill south of Chewton Mendip. Although there used to be a blacksmith in Chewton Mendip until a few years ago, horse owners must now employ a travelling farrier.
